visualization.description: Visual integration tool for exploration of experiments
visualization.help:
# What is Vitessce?
Vitessce is a flexible visualization tool for single-cell datasets, with strong support for spatial and multi-modal data. It helps you explore complex biological information—such as gene expression, cell types, and tissue structure—through interactive, coordinated views.
After selecting a dataset, Vitessce will display a grid of visual components that are linked together. For example, selecting cells in one plot can highlight those same cells in a tissue image or heatmap.
## Key Features
- **Coordinated Views**: Multiple visualizations (scatter plots, spatial images, heatmaps, etc.) update together for interactive exploration. - **High-Resolution Imaging**: View large multiplexed images directly from OME-TIFF or Zarr formats. - **Standard Format Support**: Works with AnnData, Zarr, and other common single-cell data formats. - **Flexible Integration**: Use Vitessce on the web, in notebooks, or embedded in applications. - **Developer-Friendly**: Help content like this is written in Markdown and can be customized per dataset or app context.
To dive deeper into configuration, data formats, and examples, visit: [http://vitessce.io/docs/](http://vitessce.io/docs/)
